formattedAddress: 225 Liberty St 23rd Floor, New York, NY 10281, USA
adrFormatAddress: 225 Liberty St 23rd Floor, New York, NY 10281, USA

originalText.text:
Hiring scam? I was supposedly hired mid June. I received an email asking if I would love to move forward, that they had deleted the posting on LinkedIn. The process was interesting. My contact was Olivia Claire where I had to do in processing via Skype. I had to fill out a questionnaire as part of my interview. After waiting for approval, I contacted HR to accept the position by signing a letter virtually. They said the next step would be to send me furniture and supplies to set up my home office. They directly sent me a priority ups check in the mail that I needed to deposit, that the funds would be available in 24 hrs. I had to constantly check in with Claire every morning.

June 24, I told Claire the check was returned and she said she would look into it.June 26 I checked in and she said she was looking into it and checking with management. She told me that if I didn’t want to wait for the check to go through, I would meet with Tyler the manager near me who will help set up my home office and the vendors. I had an option to go to them to meet or have them ship it over to me. The only thing, it would cost $500 for shipping. This made me skeptical so I called the phone numbers listed on the website both NY and LA and it hung up. I reached out to HR and Claire no answer. I emailed the company website to see how their hiring process works but I have not received an answer.

originalText.text: They help distribute Hey Humans products, but don't seem to have a customer service team for the company.
